about.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: concerning or relating to a particular subject
about.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She said something about leaving town.
About that car of yours. How much are you selling it for?
It’s about Tommy, doctor. He’s been sick again.
Naturally, my mother wanted to know all about it  (=all the details relating to it).
about.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: used to show why someone is angry, happy, upset etc
about.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She’s upset about missing the party.
about.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: in many different directions within a particular place, or in different parts of a place
about.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: We spent the whole afternoon walking about town.
Books were scattered about the room.
about.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: in the nature or character of a person or thing
about.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: There’s something really strange about Liza.
What I like about the job is that it’s never boring.
about.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if an organization, a job, an activity etc is about something, that is its basic purpose
about.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Leadership is all about getting your team to co-operate.
about.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Jo sensed fear and jealousy all about her.
about.translation[0].note_box[0].section: used when saying what the subject of something is
In her novels she writes about life in South Africa.
There’s something I wanted to ask you about.
a report on poverty in rural areas
Prince Saiid answered questions concerning Kuwait’s future.
The report raises a number of questions regarding food safety.
about – used especially when you want to start talking or writing about something
Dear Sir, I’m writing with regard to your advertisement in The Times.
used in business letters and in emails to introduce the subject that you are going to write about
about.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a little more or less than a particular number, amount, or size
about.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a tiny computer about as big as a postcard
We left the restaurant at round about 10.30.
about.translation[1].definitions[0].note: In written English, people usually prefer to use approximately, as it sounds more technical:
The cost to taxpayers is approximately $200 billion.
about.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: in many different directions within a place or in different parts of a place
about.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: People were rushing about, trying to find the driver.
Cushions were scattered about on the chairs.
about.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: near to you or in the same place as you
about.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Is Derek about? There’s a phone call for him.
Quick! Let’s go while there’s no-one about.
about.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: I hope she hasn’t caught flu. There’s a lot of it about.
She might get temporary work, but there’s not much about.
about.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: I was about ready to leave when somebody rang the doorbell.
It’s just about the worst mistake anyone could make.
about.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: so as to face in the opposite direction
about.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: He quickly turned about and walked away.
